inclusion.criterion: volunteers signed the informed consent to participate in the study
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: answered a questionnaire with information about demographics, epilepsy history (age of onset, frequency, last seizure, medications)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: described their emotional characteristics (intuitive, emotive, and rational) and how they felt at that moment
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: were invited to choose an emotion from a list (Concern/obsession, Anger/irritation, Fear, Compassion, Sadness, Comprehension, Euphoria, Gratitude, Joy, Peace) to work on during the intervention
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: were randomly divided into two groups: 'Control' and 'Intervention'
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: The Mandalas of Emotions refers to five colors in accordance to the five stages or seasons (spring, summer, high summer, fall, winter)
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: These establish a relation to the five functional systems (liver, heart, spleen and pancreas, lungs and kidney), and to five emotions (anger, joy/euphoria, concern/obsession, sadness/melancholy, fear) with its opposite correspondents (understanding, compassion, gratitude, enthusiasm, harmony)
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: The team, composed of five researchers, was divided in two groups: three researchers performed the interview before and after the intervention, two others applied the intervention
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Both groups received the same initial recommendations: 'please, lie down, relax and pay attention to your breath'
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: The intervention protocol was divided in two steps: first, patients spent 5 minutes in the phase of harmonization with five colored stones of a size of a walnut (green, red, yellow, white and black) placed around their bodies
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Second, in accordance to the emotion chosen by the participant, a matching mandala was placed next to the feet, on the abdomen, or next to the head depending on the self-perceived personality type, intuitive, emotive and rational for the remaining 10 minutes
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: The researcher also checked the control subjects once during the 15 fifteen minutes of experiment
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Associated clinical conditions that prevented full comprehension of research procedures
exclusion.label: triggers

notes: Patient has a history of severe intellectual disability, CHF, and epilepsy. They have had seizures in the past but were seizure-free for 20 years after being tapered off Dilantin. The patient's current presentation with facial twitching and generalized shaking may indicate a new seizure activity.
